AMENDMENTS TO ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION OR BYLAWS; CHANGE IN FISCAL YEAR. 3 &#160; &#160; ITEM 5.07. SUBMISSION OF MATTERS TO A VOTE OF SECURITY HOLDERS. 3 &#160; &#160; ITEM 9.01. FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND EXHIBITS. 5 &#160; &#160; SIGNATURES 6 &#160; &#160; EXHIBIT 3.1 &#160; &#160; &#160; EXHIBIT 3.2 &#160; Table of Contents ITEM&#160;5.03. AMENDMENTS TO ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION OR BYLAWS; CHANGE IN FISCAL YEAR. On May 27, 2020, the shareholders of Amazon.com, Inc. (the &#8220;Company&#8221;) approved an amendment to the Company&#8217;s Restated Certificate of Incorporation (the &#8220;Certificate&#8221;) to lower the stock ownership threshold from 30% to 25% for shareholders to request that the Company call a special meeting of shareholders. The Board of Directors of the Company approved a corresponding amendment to Section 2.2.2 of the Company&#8217;s Amended and Restated Bylaws (the &#8220;Bylaws&#8221;), effective May 28, 2020. This description of the amendments to the Certificate and the Bylaws is not complete and is qualified in its entirety by reference to the text of the Certificate and the Bylaws, copies of which are filed as Exhibit 3.1 and Exhibit 3.2, respectively, to this Form 8-K. ITEM&#160;5.07. SUBMISSION OF MATTERS TO A VOTE OF SECURITY HOLDERS. On May 27, 2020, the Company held its Annual Meeting of Shareholders. The following nominees were elected as directors, each to hold office until the next Annual Meeting of Shareholders or until his or her successor is elected and qualified, by the vote set forth below: Nominee &#160; For &#160; Against &#160; Abstain &#160; Broker Non-Votes Jeffrey P. Bezos &#160; 358,730,743 &#160; 8,196,701 &#160; 1,954,131 &#160; 65,004,317 Rosalind G. Brewer &#160; 367,245,268 &#160; 1,007,075 &#160; 629,232 &#160; 65,004,317 Jamie S. Gorelick &#160; 361,883,175 &#160; 4,407,847 &#160; 2,590,553 &#160; 65,004,317 Daniel P. Huttenlocher &#160; 367,085,886 &#160; 1,097,529 &#160; 698,160 &#160; 65,004,317 Judith A. McGrath &#160; 363,221,298 &#160; 3,639,975 &#160; 2,020,302 &#160; 65,004,317 Indra K. Nooyi &#160; 366,888,067 &#160; 1,340,374 &#160; 653,134 &#160; 65,004,317 Jonathan J. Rubinstein &#160; 365,093,290 &#160; 3,083,630 &#160; 704,655 &#160; 65,004,317 Thomas O. Ryder &#160; 337,609,773 &#160; 30,585,339 &#160; 686,463 &#160; 65,004,317 Patricia Q. Against &#160; Abstain &#160; Broker Non-Votes 421,878,194 &#160; 11,109,633 &#160; 898,065 &#160; &#8212; The compensation of our named executive officers as disclosed in the proxy statement was approved in an advisory vote, as set forth below: For &#160;
